data.title: Small, But Worth The Wait
data.text: One of my favorite things to do here is try their special of the day, its always exceptional.  The place is always busy, so come just before rush hour.  This is not fast food, so you do have a small wait for your food, as it is cooked to order.  If you don't know where it is, use your GPS, because you blink and you have missed it.

data.title: Small but mighty!
data.text: Not a huge please but yummy yummy yummy food! Service was not too fast but I kinda liked having some time to go over menus and in between appetizers and main course. Burgers are huge, pizzas enormous and pasta was enough for two persons!

data.title: Nice Find
data.text: My son told me about this place and I took my daughter and grandson for dinner. Small place with a lot of local charm. Not many tables so plan on a wait but worth it. The service is fantastic and the food is remarkably good. We had breadsticks and pizza and both were exceptional. Other food being served looked delishes. Next time I plan on trying the linguini with clams. Don't miss out give it a try you won't regret it.

data.title: Best Pizza in Utah
data.text: Small with EXCELLENT pizza.  Get here early or you'll wait a bit for food.  Also, if you are in a big hurry, skip Gabor Brothers.  It takes a little bit of time to create these masterpieces.  Everything is BIG here.  Two of us shared a "Small" pizza and we took 1/2 of it home.  See the pics below for an idea.  I highly recommend.....

data.title: Good Italian food, typically terrible service
data.text: Sometimes it's hard to go to a restaurant after having been a server and watch consistently Indifferent and often just terrible service.  If the food wasn't above average at this location, I would never come here. I'm sitting here with an empty tea glass for the last 15 minutes listening to the utterly "too cool" To provide proper service  staff messing with their phones and talking crap about the customers.  A less professional atmosphere would be difficult to imagine.  The salad is good and the portions are typically large, I'll give them that.  You Just have to tolerate the long wait and bad service.

data.title: Great Food!
data.text: They have wonderful food here. Love the sandwiches and the eggplant parm. Go early if you want a seat, small eating area. They do takeout also.

data.title: Great Italian
data.text: Best Italian food around.  They are a little slow as everything is made to order, but well worth the wait.  Delicious food with generous portions.

data.title: Very good little surprise
data.text: never imagine having a very good Italian lunch on our way from canyonlands to yellow sTone, actually we missed the stop over in salt lake city but was a delightful try in this city. Enjoying the nice unexpected in a journey.everything we ordered was great.

data.title: Amazing Italian food!
data.text: I loved their food!! Seriously so great! Its one of my favorites and often overlooked! Go in and try it out! They have large portions so I usually share! Love it!

data.title: Great food
data.text: My wife had spaghetti and my friend and I had the tri tip both were outstanding. We try to stop here every time we are in the area.

data.title: Breadsticks, pizza, pasta--it's all delicious!
data.text: We are long time patrons of Gabor Brothers. We especially love their delicious breadsticks--long twists of bread dough perfectly seasoned and baked. You can't go wrong with any of their pizzas and their seafood linguini is really, really good. Everything is prepared fresh after you order it, so you do need to plan on waiting. It's certainly worth it, though. Their salads are another great choice, with lots of different ingredients, not just lettuce and a few shredded carrots. Lasagna, the salmon--I really don't think we've had a bad selection. Well, this review has made me hungry. Maybe takeout from Gabor's tonight!

data.title: Awesome Local Italian and more
data.text: Great food!  I absolutely love their homemade breadsticks. Both the marinara and alfredo sauces are spectacular and the  calazone is to die for.  This place is small so plan on a wait but the food is worth it.

data.title: Over Rated
data.text:
My first visit to any Italian restaurant always includes Fettuccine Alfredo. Odds are, if you can't turn out a decent Fettuccine Alfredo you don't deserve 4 1/2 stars and/or "excellent " reviews.

Sadly, Gabor Brother's Fettuccine Alfredo was lumpy, dry and tasteless. I would not give it more than 2 stars.

Nevertheless,  I will give it one more try. It must be doing something right to earn all those stars and "excellent" reviews. Maybe next time I'll discover the secret to their success.

data.title: Used to be one of my favorites
data.text: Had the daughter and her fiance pick up a order out pizza. It was no where near the quality of quantity of their usual fare. In consideration of knowing how busy they are I emailed them a complaint. It has been two weeks without a response. I really thought they were better than this. I would suggest if you order out you pick up and check your order before you pay. My wife, my daughter and my self were all very disappointed with the quality and the sogginess of the Pizza.

data.title: Truly impressed Michigan Family
data.text: All 4 of us loved it! Which is unheard of in our family. The bruchetta is terrific, but get it with a salad and that's dinner. Portions are huge. We had eggplant parm, chicken marsala, cheesesteak sandwich, salads, soup... all fabulous. And our waitress was phenomenal!

data.title: Cteesesteak Sandwich
data.text: Incredibly good and very filling cheesesteak sandwich.  Zupa soup is also excellent!  Service is good.  Parking limited.

data.title: Love their food!
data.text: Get there early.  There are not a ton of seats but it is worth the wait.  There is a great character to the place and the food is great.

data.title: Slowest Service - Mediocre Food
data.text:
Number one complaint: It took a HOUR to get our order. We showed at 11:45am on a Friday, and was served at 12:45pm! We ordered two side salads and two calzones. Our waitress told us that it'd be "a few minutes" for our calzones due to a pizza order placed before ours. She literally kept coming to our table telling us that she's "grabbing our order now"...like three or four times. Even bringing warm marinara sauce 15 mins before the calzones. It was just poor service. 

The food: PROS: the side salad was pretty good, and they put a lot of cheese in the calzone. 
CONS: the calzone was burnt on the outside and the pepperoni was literally stacked inside. So, most bites had no meat, a few bites were all pepperoni (about an inch thick worth.) 

Overall, we couldn't believe this was ranked #2 in Layton! Floored as matter of fact. I wouldn't recommend.

data.title: Nice and cozy but the food is average
data.text: The restaurant is small, always crowded. Most table are good for 2 maximum 4, larger group would need to join table to eat comfortably. The beverage choices are good but the food are average at most. Lots of cheeze doesn't not make it a great Italian food.

data.title: Best food, people, and bang for the buck!
data.text: Gabors delivers ample amounts of food at an affordable price.  The wait staff work hard and treat their customers so well.  So what if you have to wait a bit!  The food is awesome and worth the wait!
